sentences.english: Mr. Black, I have just been married, therefore can I get a raise in my wages?
sentences.chinese: 布莱克先生，我刚刚结婚了，所以我能提薪吗？

sentences.english: I just received a terribly grhvacious cisl from Sen. McCain.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚，麦凯恩参议员很有风范地给我打了个电话。

sentences.english: She announced that his wife had just given birth to quadruplets .
sentences.chinese: 她宣称他的妻子刚刚生了四胞胎。

sentences.english: Ann: I don’t know. I just read the news.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，我刚刚读了这篇新闻。

sentences.english: Timing recently had a autumnal equinox, feel suddenly increased some cool idea.
sentences.chinese: 时序刚刚过了秋分，就觉得突然增加了一些凉意。

sentences.english: Some of you have come fresh from narrow jail cells.
sentences.chinese: 你们有些人刚刚走出狭小的牢房。

sentences.english: I congratulate my neighbor, whose son has just won the election.
sentences.chinese: 我祝贺我的邻居，他的儿子刚刚赢得选举。

sentences.english: Don't be such a party pooper , the party has just started.
sentences.chinese: 不要那么扫兴，聚会才刚刚开始。

sentences.english: Doris:I think because I turned on the air conditioner right after showering and before I blow-dried my hair.
sentences.chinese: 大概是我刚刚洗完澡没吹头发又立刻开冷气的关系吧。

sentences.english: I just had a super-duper meal in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我刚刚在餐厅吃了一顿超级大餐。

sentences.english: My essay just about reached the necessary word count, but there's an awful lot of filler text in there.
sentences.chinese: 我的文章刚刚凑够字数，但里面有一篇糟糕的补白。

sentences.english: And this from a man who, quite recently, could not trap a bag of suet.
sentences.chinese: 这都源于这个刚刚丢弃了板油包袱的男人。

sentences.english: When I am about to nod off in the office, the boss walked in.
sentences.chinese: 我在办公室刚刚欲睡，老板走了进来。

sentences.english: Galanz just about a week ago and the National US-held section of microwave ovens .
sentences.chinese: 格兰仕大约一周前刚刚与国美合作举行微波炉节。

sentences.english: I love fish and you just said there was a lake.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢钓鱼，你刚刚也说那边有个湖了。

sentences.english: Here you can see the headstock just after I finished boring it.
sentences.chinese: 在这里您可以看到启闭刚刚结束后，我无聊了。

definition: on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
